title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 10051.1 - Purpose and scope
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 10051.1 - Purpose and scope

State Regulations
(a) It is the
responsibility and the intent of the authority to fully comply with the
provisions of article 6-A of the Public Officers Law (POL), the "Personal

Privacy Protection Law."
(b) The
authority shall maintain in its records only such personal information that is
relevant and necessary to accomplish a purpose of the authority that is
required to be accomplished by statute or executive order or to implement a
program specifically authorized by law. (c) Personal information will be collected, whenever practicable, directly from the person to whom the information
pertains. (d) The authority seeks to
ensure that all records pertaining to or used with respect to individuals are
accurate, relevant, timely, and complete. (e) These regulations provide information
regarding the procedures by which members of the public may assert their rights
as granted by the Personal Privacy Protection Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
10051.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
